node.title: Religious freedom is not about a contest of rights, but a deeper question of the right to have them
node.description: As this week's debates have shown, the issue of religious freedom versus secular freedom requires a nuance and depth that evades our politics – and is far from peacefully resolved, writes Stan Grant.

node.title: 'It's having a silencing effect': Online abuse is threatening women's wellbeing — and the health of Australia's democracy
node.description: There are growing concerns online abuse is shutting down crucial conversations and pushing out voices, and ultimately threatening the health of Australia's democracy.

node.title: Denmark has taken 'living with COVID' to a whole new level. Could Australia do the same?
node.description: Denmark no longer deems COVID-19 a "socially critical sickness" and has unwound all restrictions. Here's what a return to normal life looks like.

node.title: 'It was the worst shift in my entire life': Insiders speak out about how Omicron wave smashed hospitals
node.description: Many health care workers are afraid of speaking to the media, but they are also desperate for the public to know what's been happening in our hospitals. As the Omicron wave peaked in Sydney last month, Background Briefing was following them. These are their stories — in their words — about what they saw.

node.title: Cyclone Dovi brings howling winds and heavy rain to NZ
node.description: The MetService is warning much of the North Island is in for a wild night of howling winds and heavy rain as the remnants of Cyclone Dovi pass over.

node.title: Ex-airport official caught in record-setting bribe scheme found dead
node.description: The government had warned the judge that he might flee or harm himself if granted bond while filing appeals, The Detroit News reported.

node.title: Russian false-flag plan prompts U.S. to plan for worst in Ukraine
node.description: The new granular information about Russia's plan was discussed in the Situation Room Thursday.

node.title: U.S. coach accused of sexual misconduct, racer probed for slurs
node.description: Former snowboardcross rider Callan Chythlook-Sifsof, a member of the 2010 Olympic team, made the accusations.

node.title: Wellington Phoenix break win drought in first season
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix women have won their first match in the A-League with a 3-0 victory over Canberra United in Canberra.

node.title: Undefeated champion eyes third boxing belt
node.description: Mother of five Mea Motu will fight anyone. Now she is chasing history in the ring.

node.title: Afghans protest U.S. order to give $3.5 billion to 9/11 victims
node.description: Protesters who gathered outside Kabul's grand Eid Gah mosque asked America for financial compensation for the tens of thousands of Afghans killed during the last 20 years of war.

node.title: The Rise in Book Bans and Censorship
node.description: Readers discuss complaints against “Maus,” “To Kill a Mockingbird,” “Beloved” and other books.

node.title: ‘Improbable Journey’: How a Movie From Tiny Bhutan Got an Oscar Nod
node.description: “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom” was filmed on a shoestring budget in a remote Himalayan village. It’s now an Academy Award nominee, a first for Bhutan.

node.title: Suspect charged four decades after teen killed: "40 long years"
node.description: The body of Denise Marie Pierson, who was reported missing in 1981, was found in 1984 near railroad tracks about 300 yards from the home of one of those suspects.

node.title: Jaclyn Narracott wins stunning skeleton silver for Australia
node.description: Jaclyn Narracott's skeleton silver medal is Australia's first medal of any colour in the sliding events at a Winter Olympic Games.

node.title: Alabama teacher accused of having class perform Nazi salute
node.description: A Jewish student said school officials reprimanded him and told him to apologize to the teacher after he shared a video of the incident on social media.

node.title: Canadian police arrive to remove protesters at busiest U.S. border crossing
node.description: Protesters had until 7 p.m. Friday to clear out. But the deadline came and went.

node.title: Russian figure skater's doping case to be heard Sunday at Olympics
node.description: The 15-year-old skater, the favorite to win the gold medal, broke down in tears after an emotional practice session Saturday.

node.title: U.S. orders employees to leave embassy in Kyiv
node.description: Diplomatic sources told CBS News that embassy evacuations started overnight.

node.title: New Zealand turns to Barry Manilow songs and sprinklers to flush out protesters in Wellington
node.description: As a demonstration against vaccination mandates and COVID-19 restrictions stretches into a fifth day, parliament speaker Trevor Mallard authorises the use of sprinklers and Barry Manilow music in an attempt to encourage people to head home.

node.title: Covid-19: 454 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: The number of daily Covid-19 cases in the community has reached a new high, up slightly to 454 today.

node.title: Melbourne meeting sees India split from Quad on Ukraine invasion fears
node.description: India's External Affairs Minister has split from his Quad counterparts over the threat of a Russian invasion in Ukraine, saying he wants the group to focus on collaboration rather than confrontation.

node.title: NZ government: Kiwis in Ukraine should leave immediately
node.description: The government is calling on New Zealanders in Ukraine to leave immediately, amid heightened military tension in the area.

node.title: Some New Zealand olive oils found to be not 100% local
node.description: Olive oil that says 'New Zealand' on the bottle may not always be what it is claimed to be.

node.title: Canada and the United States are clashing in men’s hockey.
node.description: The two powerhouses had to cobble together teams after the N.H.L. declined to allow its players to compete.

node.title: Winton firefighters isolating after Covid exposure
node.description: Firefighters from Winton Volunteer Fire Brigade are currently isolating after being identified as close contacts of a positive Covid-19 case.

node.title: Access to birth injury care inequitable - obstetrician
node.description: An obstetrician and gynaecologist says women who have suffered injuries giving birth wait much longer for treatment in certain regions.

node.title: One person stabbed, police officer hit from behind at boy racer gathering
node.description: One person was stabbed and a police officer was struck in the head from behind at a boy racer gathering in Longburn near Palmerston North last night.

node.title: Trucker protests: Ontario calls state of emergency
node.description: Ontario has declared a state of emergency in response to two weeks of protests against Covid-19 restrictions.

node.title: Koalas now considered endangered in NSW, Queensland and the ACT
node.description: Koalas are now considered an endangered species in NSW, Queensland and the ACT, as numbers plummet due to climate change, land clearing and disease.
